intro: Micromeria myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtleleaf micromeria, is a small shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage emits a subtle myrtle-like scent, which is a distinguishing botanical feature. Micromeria myrtifolia is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
